Indications and doses

Severe insomnia (short-term use),

By mouth using oral solution

  • For adults elderly
    192–384 mg daily, dose to be taken at bedtime.
  • For adults elderly
    5–10 mL daily, dose to be taken at bedtime.

Restlessness and agitation,

By mouth using oral solution

  • For adults elderly
    192 mg 3 times a day.
  • For adults elderly
    5 mL 3 times a day.

Alcohol withdrawal,

By mouth using oral solution

  • For adults
    Initially 2–4 capsules, to be repeated if necessary after some hours, then (by mouth) 9–12 capsules daily in 3–4 divided doses for day 1 (first 24 hours), then (by mouth) 6–8 capsules daily in 3–4 divided doses for day 2, then (by mouth) 4–6 capsules daily in 3–4 divided doses for day 3, dose then to be gradually reduced over days 4–6, total treatment for not more than 9 days.
  • For adults
    Initially 10–20 mL, to be repeated if necessary after some hours, then 45–60 mL daily in 3–4 divided doses for day 1 (first 24 hours), then 30–40 mL daily in 3–4 divided doses for day 2, then 20–30 mL daily in 3–4 divided doses for day 3, dose then to be gradually reduced over days 4–6, total treatment for not more than 9 days.

Dose equivalence and conversion

1 capsule contains 192 mg of clomethiazole base.

Advice when patient is pregnant

Avoid if possible—especially during the first and third trimesters.

Advice regarding hepatic impairment

Reduce dose.

Can precipitate coma.

Advice regarding renal impairment

Start with small doses in severe impairment.

Increased cerebral sensitivity.

Contra indications

  • Acute pulmonary insufficiency
  • alcohol-dependent patients who continue to drink

Known side effects

General side effects

commonOrVeryCommon: Conjunctival irritation, headache, increased bronchial secretions, increased nasopharyngeal secretions, nasal congestion, nasal irritation,

rare: Alterations in liver enzymes, anaphylaxis, bullous eruption, confusion, dependence, gastro-intestinal disturbances, paradoxical excitement, rash, urticaria,

Advice for patients and carers

Cautions regarding administration

  • Avoid prolonged use (and abrupt withdrawal thereafter)
  • cardiac disease (confusional state may indicate hypoxia)
  • chronic pulmonary insufficiency
  • elderly
  • excessive sedation may occur (particularly with higher doses);
  • history of drug abuse
  • marked personality disorder
  • respiratory disease (confusional state may indicate hypoxia)
  • sleep apnoea syndrome

Prepared medicinal forms of CLOMETHIAZOLE

There can be variation in the licensing of different medicines containing the same drug.

Oral solution
